result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

off record. Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michelle D. Sturdevant in court.  Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge Sr. in court for Michelle D. Sturdevant. Offer received. Atty Dodge requesting more time. No objection from the State. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Off record. Attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Michelle D. Sturdevant in court.  Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge Sr. in court for Michelle D. Sturdevant. No offer received. State will make an offer. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle D. Sturdevant in court.  Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge Sr. in court for Michelle D. Sturdevant. Defendant waives reading of Information and understands charges in both files and the max penalties if convicted. Defendant enters pleas of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Defendant request PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michelle D. Sturdevant in court. Atty Gary Dodge appeared for defendant. VWC Rachael Race in court. Court makes stmt. PQW received/reviewed by the Court. Court finds the defendant's waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been made and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Court proceeds w/ 22CF80
Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
$500 bail bond payment confirmation and Bail Bond Acknowledgment Form

Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

covers both files (22CF80 and 22CF137). $200 cash posted on 5/23/2022. Additional $500 needs to be posted. 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ T.P. and/or T.B. Not to reside w/ T.B. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

2:41 PM Defendant Michelle D. Sturdevant in court.  Attorney Gary Stephen Dodge Sr. in court for Michelle D. Sturdevant. ADA Larry Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Rachael Race/VWC in court. Defendant and Atty Dodge reviewed complaint and defendant understands charge and possible penalty. Defendant request PH within time limits. State makes stmt. Court sets bond.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
